item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, December 25, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS menu bar app that shows how full the ISS urine tank is in real time (615 points | 140 comments)
2. T * sin (t)' ≈ Ornamented Christmas Tree (2013) (149 points | 10 comments)
3. Show HN: FixBrowser – a lightweight web browser created from scratch (51 points | 14 comments)
4. Trying out QvQ – Qwen's new visual reasoning model (147 points | 42 comments)
5. Merry Christmas Everyone (316 points | 111 comments)
6. CRT Simulation in a GPU Shader, Looks Better Than Black Frame Insertion (53 points | 9 comments)
7. Exploring LoRA – Part 1: The Idea Behind Parameter Efficient Fine-Tuning (49 points | 2 comments)
8. A Taping of 'Curb Your Enthusiasm' Saved an Innocent Man from Death Row (2017) (39 points | 26 comments)
9. Spectral Imaging Made Easy: A Powerful Python Library (8 points | 2 comments)
10. This open problem taught me what topology is [video] (3 points | discuss)
11. Masks, Smoke, and Mirrors: The story of EgyptAir flight 804 (145 points | 62 comments)
12. Will that hub or dock slow your SSDs, or even make them faster? (54 points | 37 comments)
13. Adversarial policies beat superhuman Go AIs (2023) (265 points | 111 comments)
14. Shockley Semiconductor Laboratory (74 points | 27 comments)
15. A pilot raced through the airport to surprise the woman who saved his life (34 points | discuss)
16. Are Immutable Linux Distros right for you? (40 points | 19 comments)
17. The number pi has an evil twin (479 points | 187 comments)
18. Ruby 3.4.0 Released (8 points | 1 comment)
19. Earth's subsurface may hold up to 5.6 × 10⁶ million metric tons of hydrogen (27 points | 25 comments)
20. Jujutsu Megamerges and jj Absorb (33 points | 8 comments)
21. What happened to the world's largest tube TV? [video] (633 points | 275 comments)
22. Hoarder: Self-hostable bookmark-everything app (308 points | 58 comments)
23. Gordon Mah Ung has died (98 points | 15 comments)
24. What would it take to add refinement types to Rust? (100 points | 54 comments)
25. Minutes of a Meeting Held at Gear Ratio on Tuesday 13 June 78 [pdf] (22 points | 7 comments)
26. On the nature of computing science (1984) (221 points | 88 comments)
27. A Practitioner's Guide to Wide Events (50 points | 28 comments)
28. Cerebrum: Simulate and infer synaptic connectivity in large-scale brain networks (87 points | 66 comments)
29. News for Ruby 3.4.0 (4 points | 1 comment)
30. Making AMD GPUs competitive for LLM inference (2023) (280 points | 180 comments)
